      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(Frame3 frame,
                     Vector3 incDir,
                     Vector3 outDir,
                     Color outBRDFValue)
        Given the incident direction, reflection direction, compute the BRDF value. The w component fo Frame3 aligns with the surface normal
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface BRDF
        Parameters:
        frame - The w component of Frame3 aligns with the surface normal
        incDir - incident direction in canonical coordinates
        outDir - outgoing direction also in canonical coordinates
        outBRDFValue - output brdf value
        See Also:
        BRDF.evaluate(ray.math.Frame3, ray.math.Vector3, ray.math.Vector3, ray.misc.Color)

      • generate

        public void generate(Frame3 frame,
                     Vector3 fixedDir,
                     Vector3 dir,
                     Point2 seed,
                     Color outWeight)
        f * |o.n| / Po = 4 * f * |o.n| * |i.m| / (D(m)*|m.n|)
        Specified by:
        generate in interface BRDF
        Parameters:
        seed - is uniformly distributed in square [0...1]
        fixedDir - outgoing direction is specified
        dir - incident direction is generated according to half angle direction which is generated from random seed
        frame - The surface frame
        outWeight - The weight for an unbiased estimate (value / pdf)

      • pdf

        public double pdf(Frame3 frame,
                  Vector3 fixedDir,
                  Vector3 dir)
        Evaluate the PDF used by generate(), with respect to the solid angle measure. Given the fixedDir, what is the PDF value to select the direction at dir? For uniform sample, the pdf is p(dir|uniform) = cos(theta)/PI For importance sample, the pdf is p(dir|importance) = Po So the overall p(dir) = p(dir, uniform)+p(dir, importance) = cos(theta)/PI * (1-weight) + Po * weight The value of Po = Pm * ||partial(half_angle)/partial(outDir)||
        Specified by:
        pdf in interface BRDF
        Parameters:
        frame - The w component of Frame3 aligns with the surface normal
        fixedDir - The fixed argument of the BRDF
        dir - The variable argument
        Returns:
        The pdf of generate() choosing dir if given fixedDir

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
